c5ab8c94-fe16-413e-8bab-75bedf3fca77.description: Earners of the Skin Cancer Educator badge will have successfully completed NUR 2990 or 2900, have the ability to recognize skin cancer lesions, distinguish between benign and cancerous lesions and refer patients to their health care providers for further evaluation and treatment. Earners can educate clients about skin cancer and sun protective behaviors to prevent skin cancer.
c5ab8c94-fe16-413e-8bab-75bedf3fca77.name: Skin Cancer Educator Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete NUR 2990 or NUR 2900.
Successfully complete the analysis of cases 1 and 2 of the Informed Skin Cancer Education Series.
View two online lectures by Dr. Victoria Siegel
Complete online American Cancer Society quiz on Skin Cancer
Complete a Skin Cancer Questionnaire

ea5260f8-64f6-45bc-b6ec-a76eccde435d.description: Participants of this credential are high achieving juniors in high school that have demonstrated a strong interest in business. Recipients are able to showcase their creativity, enthusiasm, and leadership skills by participating in hands-on activities while learning about various programs within the School of Business.
ea5260f8-64f6-45bc-b6ec-a76eccde435d.name: Molloy University Business Boot Camp

badge_template_activities.title: Participants are high achieving high school juniors who have a strong interest in business. They will actively participate in all activities, competitions and seminars throughout the program.
Participants will demonstrate their leadership skills while collaborating with the Molloy faculty, staff and peers.

Participants will enhance their networking skills while experiencing the culture of Molloy University. Molloy faculty and staff will lecture on the importance of networking and the value internships play in acquiring steller job placement.
Submit a well written 200-300 word essay of the three most important “takeaways” from the Boot Camp experience.

5770900e-8a92-43d2-b6c1-1205c40b96dc.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated an understanding of the structure and function of viruses and the evolution of pandemics. Students learned about the latest tests available for Sars-Cov2, discussed vaccine development, how to effectively communicate to the public, and analyze data from primary research as it is available.
5770900e-8a92-43d2-b6c1-1205c40b96dc.name: Summer Academy - Communicating & Understanding the Science of Coronavirus

badge_template_activities.title: Participants completed an 8-hour workshop consisting of online instruction and hands-on applied group work focusing on COVID-19 Coronavirus.
Participants exhibited critical inquiry and data analysis skills of the SARS-CoV-2. Displayed analysis and critical thinking skills through peer discussions.

Participants reviewed the general structure and function of viruses. In addition, through group discussions, participants gained an overall understanding of how the immune system works and its role in fighting viruses.

Participants reviewed both primary and secondary sources which resulted in learning to read and analyze data from the lab. They also compared their analysis of how media outlets reported on the virus and presented to their comparisons to peer groups.

40d02b6a-edca-4492-b027-f0bcbcbf9f7a.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated an understanding of the history of activism through the arts, culminating in the creation of their own personal works. Students demonstrated the ability to think creatively, translate abstract concepts to a wide array of physical materials, and articulate verbally and/or in written artist statements their points of view.
40d02b6a-edca-4492-b027-f0bcbcbf9f7a.name: Summer Academy - Arts in Action

badge_template_activities.title: Participants completed a 4-day workshop focusing on translating their personal causes and beliefs into different artistic mediums.
Participants exhibited critical inquiry and analysis skills of data through history and translated that into current and personalized works of artistic expression.
Participants took information from the workshop and transformed it into visual, verbal, musical, and/or written descriptions to be exhibited for the outside world to witness.
Participants demonstrated punctuality, good work habits, and followed through with all objectives described throughout the four days.

skills.name: Translating Concepts Into Works Of Artistic Expression

4d51655d-10d8-4df9-a3bc-d3b9d1e17639.description: Earners of this badge critically played and analyzed video games while learning theoretical frameworks. Learned beginner-friendly game design programs such as Twine, RPG Maker, and GameMaker and created youtube content, images, and gifs.
4d51655d-10d8-4df9-a3bc-d3b9d1e17639.name: Summer Academy - Gaming & Video Storytelling

badge_template_activities.title: Participants completed an 8-hour workshop of online instruction focusing on interactive storytelling and game creation on Twine.
Participants exhibited critical inquiry and procedural thinking skills through game creation, including basic coding skills.
Participants displayed the ability to assess game play and apply custom features to individual games.
Participants exhibited the ability to comprehend and apply complex information.
Participants demonstrated punctuality, exhibited good work habits outside of the classroom, and followed through with all objectives described throughout the four days.

9930256d-d742-464d-9a74-1f04ae551ce4.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated an understanding of decoding the history of visual storytelling, culminating with a creation of their own personal narrative work(s) of art. Students demonstrated the ability to think creatively, translate abstract concepts to a wide array of physical materials, and articulate verbally and/or in written artist statements their points of view.
9930256d-d742-464d-9a74-1f04ae551ce4.name: Summer Academy - Visual Storytelling

badge_template_activities.title: • Participants completed an 8-hour workshop of online instruction focusing on decoding 2020 and translating what that means through visual symbols and materials to create personalized narratives.

• Participants exhibited critical inquiry and analysis skills of data through history and translated that into current and personalized visual documentation. Displayed the ability to maneuver their thinking through global to micro cosmic topics, intuitively to literal concepts and universal to individual realities.
• Participants were able to take the information in the workshop and transform that into visual, verbal and written descriptions to be exhibited for the outside world to witness.
• Participants demonstrated punctuality, good work habits outside of the classroom, and followed through with all objectives described throughout the four days.

skills.name: Decoding Of Surroundings And Translating Into Visual Imagery

6ebdb3dd-66db-4c2b-b917-bb8eb0779637.description: Earners of the Biology and Environmental Science Research badge have successfully completed 3 research courses over 3 consecutive semesters (BIO 2570/ENV 2570 Scientific Research Techniques, BIO 4800/ENV 4800 Research in Biology I/Research in Environmental Studies I, and BIO 4910/ENV 4910 Research Thesis) a Responsible Conduct in Research Workshop & the CITI training and earned the completion certificate. The skills developed prepare students for graduate-level work and broad career paths.
6ebdb3dd-66db-4c2b-b917-bb8eb0779637.name: Biology & Environmental Research

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed the research series of 3 courses over 3 consecutive semesters (BIO 2570/ENV 2570 Scientific Research Techniques, BIO 4800/ENV 4800 Research in Biology I/Research in Environmental Studies I, and BIO 4910/ENV 4910 Research Thesis), the biomedical research module of the CITI training and earned the completion certificate.
Completed a 15-hour Responsible Conduct in Research Workshop and CITI training modules focused on Responsible Research with Human Participants with a certificate.
Completed and orally presented a research thesis project at Molloy College.
Present their research thesis at a regional or national conference via oral presentation or poster format.

ea39482e-3495-40e5-b1c4-0531abb0a337.description: Students will address the broad issues of global citizenship from specific and cross‐disciplinary perspectives. Students will contemplate: What does globalization mean for our economic, political, cultural and social realities? What are our civic responsibilities? What does it mean to be a Global Citizen? The academy exposes the idea of perspective allowing students to develop the knowledge and commitment to attach their own narrative to “What is the Truth.
ea39482e-3495-40e5-b1c4-0531abb0a337.name: Summer Academy - Global Citizenship

badge_template_activities.title: Participants completed a reflection paper after listening to the experiences of Holocaust survivors.
Participants discussed human rights and how it is embedded in the UN sustainable goals.

skills.name: Awareness Of UN Sustainable Development Goals
Evaluate And Assess Global And Local Issues With An Informed Perspective
Recognizing The Commonalities And Differences Among People And Cultures

ff9204c5-741b-4e8a-bb9b-6c8abf529115.description: The TV Studio Production Academy is a hands-on workshop for high school students interested in producing a television series. Students will learn aspects of script writing, record shows in the College's television studio, and edit video footage using industry software. Students will gain experience building a set, directing talent, operating a studio production camera, and using control room equipment (audio and graphics). This workshop covers the beginning steps for a career in screenwriting.
ff9204c5-741b-4e8a-bb9b-6c8abf529115.name: Summer Academy - TV Studio

badge_template_activities.title: • Use professional industry software such as Final draft to write single column scripts and Adobe Premiere Pro to edit video footage.
• Record and direct a television series using video production equipment.
• Understand technical and non-technical production roles including director, camera operator, audio engineer, lighting technician, and floor manager, among others.
• Utilize high-definition studio cameras by incorporating theories such as camera composition and movements.

55866ac7-1917-4f35-98e4-960cf89b6d45.description: This badge will demonstrate an understanding of Long Island surrounding waters. We’re not only surrounded by water, we are also dependent on its ecological health. This track will delve into the exciting world of coastal science: understanding water quality, geomorphology, natural resources management of shellfish to finfish, meteorology, and the particulars of inventory and monitoring of various forms sea life. Students will explore careers in environmental science and/or marine biology.
55866ac7-1917-4f35-98e4-960cf89b6d45.name: Summer Academy - Coastal Ecology Field Experience

badge_template_activities.title: Participants collected daily water samples, Phytoplankton/grab sampling and Meteorological data.
Participants were trained on trend analysis and long-term data analysis.

Participants explored how to successfully care for aquatic systems within the labs. This will involve students learning how to test the water parameters amongst the tanks to determine what needs to be adjusted for the well-being of the living animals (invertebrates).
Participants participated  in feeding our Horseshoe Crabs and learn about basic Horseshoe Crab anatomy and conduct Aquaculture Tank Testing.
Participants led small group discussions on activities and provide their summary/takeaways.

dcc457b0-6ee4-4704-a91e-50d0bba60182.description: Earners of this badge learned and experienced CPU architecture and coding in assembly language, high-level languages such as C and Python and basic algorithms, fundamentals of the Linux operating system and networking and simple circuit design and demonstration.
dcc457b0-6ee4-4704-a91e-50d0bba60182.name: Summer Academy - Raspberry Pi

badge_template_activities.title: Students learned about IP and MAC addresses, their purpose, and the twisted pair colors and numbers in the wire.
Students built Ethernet Cat-5 patch cables and used a switch to create a local network of Raspberry Pis.

Students used SSH to connect to a cloud-based virtual computer and wrote simple x86 Assembly Language code to compile, debug and understand how integers, characters and floating point numbers are represented in the CPU.
Students solved some computer problems such as Zeller's congruence in Python and created a simple binomial hash algorithm in Python.
Students learned the binary and hexadecimal numbering systems and where they are used.
Students programmed applications, experienced operating system user, file, and process management and basic circuit design.
Students learned about Raspberry Pi's operating system, the Linux.

skills.name: Application Coding In Multiple Common Computer Languages
Simple Microprocessor Device Design And Configuration

7bd1b7dd-7107-4001-8919-4c7ee4b8fda4.description: Students will gain proficiency in writing scripts for film, television, and video on demand streaming platforms. Using industry software, students will learn to write scenes that encompasses dialogue for characters, describing visuals such as actions, settings, and special effects, and organizing storylines (plot) that entertain potential viewers. Students will recognize that a script is an essential document and blueprint to bring script to screen.
7bd1b7dd-7107-4001-8919-4c7ee4b8fda4.name: Summer Academy - Scriptwriting for TV

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a four day workshop in scriptwriting.
Draft and share script with fellow attendees of the workshop for peer review.
Pitch their television series or movie for approval to the instructor/producer.
Complete a script for a movie or television pilot episode.

skills.name: Ability To Describe Visual Storytelling Techniques.
Utilize Three-act Structure To Explain The Plot In A Television Episode Or Movie.
Write Scripts Using Professional Industry Software Final Draft.
Write Short Form Scripts In Single And Dual Column Format.

591a199a-e4c6-4880-a335-60d8d2bfc18a.description: Through Molloy’s membership with Quality Matters (QM), the Office of Blended & Online Learning has been dedicated to upholding continuous improvement. Molloy’s Quality Online Course Design badge celebrates quality online courses designed to support diverse students in achieving the stated learning objectives. The badge indicates that the online course has met the selected standards of Molloy’s Abbreviated Quality Matters Checklist, which represents a subset of the Quality Matters Rubric.
591a199a-e4c6-4880-a335-60d8d2bfc18a.name: School of Education and Human Services Quality Online Course Design

alignments.name: Molloy's Abbreviated Quality Matters Checklist
alignments.description: For more information and to obtain a copy of Molloy's Abbreviated Quality Matters Checklist, please contact CourseDesign@molloy.edu.

badge_template_activities.title: Molloy faculty member who has taught the online course within the past year.

The faculty will have successfully completed Molloy's Teach, Learn, Course Design Online (TLC) or earned a TLC waiver. TLC is a fully online, 2-week faculty development course focusing on best practices of hybrid and online teaching and learning. TLC covers the hybrid/online mindset shift, framing and designing a hybrid/online course, active learning strategies, aligned assessments, and ongoing resources.

The faculty will have successfully completed Molloy's Reviewing Course Design with Quality Matters (RCDQM). RCDQM is a fully online, 2-week faculty development course that includes an introduction to Quality Matters (QM), a detailed review of the QM Standards, and guidance on how to apply the QM Rubric.
The online course will have met all of the standards listed in Molloy's Abbreviated QM Checklist at an 85% level as reviewed by two internal Molloy reviewers.

4852d901-3474-4922-85d8-7937532d0f7b.description: After earning the Jazz Workshop Badge, the individual will be able to apply basic jazz theory concepts in an original composition using the music software Sibelius and Logic Pro. Participants will learn and perform the works of their peers, rehearse the music, and improvise over the tracks created by the students.
4852d901-3474-4922-85d8-7937532d0f7b.name: Summer Academy - Foundations of Jazz

badge_template_activities.title: Participants learned basic concepts of jazz harmony, scales, and theory.
Participants created an original composition using the notation software Sibelius and Logic Pro.
Participants wrote, performed, improvised, and recorded their own jazz composition.

skills.name: Basics Of Sibelius And Logic Pro Music Software
Jazz Composition Using Professional Music Software

231164ea-69f2-4e87-87d2-476fafaf531e.description: Earners of the Advanced Digital Media Production badge have demonstrated how to successfully use video equipment to create advanced still and moving image content, front end web development, and graphic design. Earners have also demonstrated competency in feature length video production or short form video storytelling, content management, creation, and editing.
231164ea-69f2-4e87-87d2-476fafaf531e.name: Advanced Digital Media Production

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed courses COM 3670 Editing and Post-Production, NMD 3920 Advanced Online Content Production, COM 3520 Advanced Field Production OR NMD 3100 Video Storytelling for the Web (9 credits).
Successfully completed COM 3670 Editing and Post-Production and NMD 3920 Advanced Online Content Production (6 credits).
Successfully completed one of the following: COM 3520 Advanced Field Production OR NMD 3100 Video Storytelling for the Web.
Pursue Adobe certification in selected still and moving image platforms.

420745c5-e701-46b2-be91-0d34df85226a.description: Earners of the Digital Media Production badge will demonstrate how to successfully use filming equipment such as operating a camera and editing content for social media, front end web development, and graphic design. Earners will also demonstrate competency in video and digital media production, content management, creation, and editing.
420745c5-e701-46b2-be91-0d34df85226a.name: Digital Media Production

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete courses NMD 2430 Introduction to New Media, NMD 2440 Online Content Production, COM 2560 Field Production, COM 2620 Social Media (12 credits). Effectively demonstrate oral and written communication skills when discussing the process of rapidly evolving media.
Efficiently research techniques in Social Media platforms and topics.
Create various types of new media, including, but not limited to, GIFs, graphics, text, images, and video.
Develop a website to host materials created in class and outside of class.
Produce an independent creative project that displays a unique online presence.

85d23763-1521-430d-b95c-b484de9db089.description: The Healthcare Administration badge consists of three courses that will provide students with foundational knowledge about the healthcare industry. Courses include topics such as healthcare delivery systems, healthcare payment systems, healthcare accounting practices, and approaches to healthcare marketing. All coursework is focused on the unique qualities of the healthcare industry.
85d23763-1521-430d-b95c-b484de9db089.name: Healthcare Administration

badge_template_activities.title: BUS 5540 – Accounting for Healthcare, BUS 5550 – Healthcare Marketing, BUS 5580 – Healthcare Organization and Delivery.

90cfc46d-8a0b-402f-8658-41377649427d.description: Achievers of this badge will increase awareness for health promotion with a focus on heart health. Participants will gain an in-depth understanding of heart safety, health promotion, and community health needs. Participants will develop strong communication and organizational skills. Participants will also demonstrate leadership skills and serve as a resource for heart healthy programs.
90cfc46d-8a0b-402f-8658-41377649427d.name: Heart Safe

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge will bring awareness of the mission of the American Heart Association and the heart health initiative. Earners will have an increased awareness of health promotion with a focus on heart health. Earners will gain an in-depth understanding of heart safety, health promotion, and community health needs and serve as a resource for heart-healthy programs. Earners will take part in campus-wide and/or community-wide activities as Hands only CPR events on campus or in the community.

33b0df37-c26f-41e9-88c4-cc9b6e7537d5.description: The Marketing Analytics badge consists of three courses that will provide students with the foundational knowledge about data compilation and developing an analytical skill set. Courses include topics such as big data, social marketing, data visualization, and interpreting quantitative results. All coursework is focused on market research, forecasting trends, and proper reporting in industry.
33b0df37-c26f-41e9-88c4-cc9b6e7537d5.name: Marketing Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: MKT 3380 – Marketing Research, MKT 3420 – Digital Media Marketing, MKT 3390 – Marketing Analytics.

b78dc7e9-89f3-4b74-90e2-a3c6c0cdbd06.description: The Marketing Strategy and Planning badge consists of three courses that will provide students with the appropriate knowledge on how to communicate to various consumer markets. Courses include topics such as the consumer decision-making process, building brand-loyal customers, integrated marketing communications, and approaches toward navigating the marketing environment. All coursework is focused on knowing your customer, building long-term relationships, and cultivating your consumer base.
b78dc7e9-89f3-4b74-90e2-a3c6c0cdbd06.name: Marketing Strategy and Planning

badge_template_activities.title: MKT 2350 – Consumer Behavior, MKT 3440 – Advertising and Integrated Marketing, MKT 3370 – Marketing Strategy.

17b57c95-f21d-4723-a285-a2f86375c10e.description: Earners of the Peer Mentor badge have demonstrated motivation and a commitment for ethical leadership through helping first year students. Earners gained experience mentoring students in areas including time management, study strategies, college expectations, and building relationships with peers. Earners successfully demonstrated skills in public speaking to groups, providing guidance, facilitating meaningful and reflective discussions, and helping students acclimate to college life.
17b57c95-f21d-4723-a285-a2f86375c10e.name: Peer Mentoring

badge_template_activities.title: Earners exhibited leadership skills through helping students acclimate to college life.
Earners completed at least 20-25 hours mentoring students and provide logs of activities.
Earners answered student questions one on one or in a group setting.
Earners communicated with mentees regularly to answer questions and motivate students.
Earners successfully completed a 1-hour team building workshop.

b88087fd-a6da-492e-8971-2bbfb0a465c4.description: The Project Management badge consists of three courses that will provide students with the core skills necessary to effectively lead and manage complex projects. Coursework will enable students to understand how complex organizations behave, as well as how projects are managed within such organizations. Additionally, students learn how to develop project timelines, work with teams, and employ a multidisciplinary approach to project management.
b88087fd-a6da-492e-8971-2bbfb0a465c4.name: Project Management

badge_template_activities.title: BUS 5110 – Organizational Behavior, BUS 5860 – Project Management, BUS 5870 – Project Management II.
